other_tests.findings: No evidence of vegetations or paravalvular abscesses; moderate atheromatous disease of the descending thoracic aorta with several protruding plaques, including one that appeared ulcerated.
Positive, with an induration that was 16 mm in diameter.
Small foci of increased uptake in the cervical spine, right foot, and right knee; findings most consistent with the presence of degenerative changes.
Yielded gram-negative rods consistent with Brucella melitensis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Initial identification of gram-negative bacillus as Moraxella phenylpyruvica, later identified as B. melitensis.

other_tests.findings: High titer of IgM and IgG antibodies (1:640) to Brucella species.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Elevated immunoglobulin titers detectable one to two weeks after infection; may persist for weeks or months after effective therapy.
